title: Career Development Framework (2012): Career Research and Development 1
subject: Career Development Framework (2012-2022)

F0D00A86F7874AFABD651BB5B0BBF254.description: Evaluate how technology has changed and determine implications for one’s lifelong learning.

54877B7B5AE54365911605E54331A38E.description: Explain how society’s needs/functions and economic conditions affect one’s career development (e.g. demographics, global competition, economic recession, and war).

EFB8F1501682487D8DDC78BC5C986DE3.description: Evaluate selection of specific postsecondary education and training programs as they relate to changing societal and economic conditions and update personal and career goals.

6542C03694564C28B703A3D60EC8B0F8.description: Explain that our diverse and changing economy requires the updating of existing skills and the acquisition of new skills throughout life.

62847C21414E40F5A007EC82D493AB28.description: Evaluate the impact of lifelong learning on one’s ability to function effectively in a diverse and changing economy.

C0E88E3855DE4C1C82F7BCD315A643BC.description: Analyze and compare school and work needs with regard to interests, skills, and values to determine if long term goals are met.

E3E6E3D15F7645A195EA9A3589F24AF8.description: Describe how education, work, family issues, national crisis and economic/labor market conditions affect decisions.

428D91C851F14D44B881D95158AB5713.description: Explain that many skills and behaviors are needed to manage one’s career development (e.g. resiliency, self-efficacy, ability to scan the environment for trends and changes, having a futures perspective, and flexibility).

4FBBFF06D4C6424FA772D463359210DC.description: Determine changes and trends that may impact career plans and develop short- and long-term goals.

D9D2B7429EB8429A87457F9891B4CF6E.description: Apply career management and decision-making skills to update ones’ career plan as needed.

5ACE011867E7475C8E24FC301AD7ABED.description: Career Satisfaction and Transition – Individuals shall demonstrate how the ongoing attainment of knowledge and skills enhances one’s ability to function and transition effectively in a diverse and changing economy.

41F41047A50B46C19F33507C35FD29CA.description: Make decisions about the advantages and challenges of employment in a non-traditional career.

BDEE6C924C8149758678CB5CE1C3F3BF.description: Demonstrate proficiency in transferable skills that lead to advancement within a career cluster of occupations (e.g. business management finance cluster: financial management and accounting, legal services, regulatory compliance, risk management, government relations, marketing.)

E0B41F4A276841AA805F968E2CAAFAED.description: Demonstrate skills to seek employment including writing a resume and cover letter, completing a job application, interviewing for a job, finding and pursuing employment leads and marketing oneself in the workplace.

E7AA28B18E6D46F08CF4B0854810D8A6.description: Demonstrate proficiency in academic and career-related content standards, academic content standards and Skills for Success.

08EB52CC22BF438D8DB3F29E94171367.description: Understand how academic, technical, cross cluster and employability skills are needed to obtain or create, maintain, and advance in one’s career.

B61EAFA103E34924BEE9281FDFE68A21.description: Job-Seeking and Advancement – Students shall demonstrate skills to secure, maintain and advance in employment.

88572B92DF1B4F1F94F62F0C0D7EE81B.description: Develop and complete the steps and timelines for taking post secondary entrance tests, choosing and applying to colleges / training programs, and gaining admission, obtaining financial aid (FAFSA) or selecting employment options.

CBF3E94EFD434FE386B8E4B5E6B009BB.description: Identify problems and/or gaps in the existing academic and career plan annually.

455383A16873445FAE95BBD14F2378DC.description: Use the selected decision-making process/model to update and modify the six-year academic and career plan.

473ECA37484742F49B2473DA5813A0A0.description: Develop a career folder /portfolio to demonstrate academic and technical knowledge and skills of a career cluster for employment and postsecondary preparation.

B6690D67392C4A97B25B8156D48D2801.description: Demonstrate academic and career related skill and the Skills for Success through project- based learning and, if applicable, CTE programs of study and other career connecting activities

44F10EE2B4CC4BCDAF710F521EAF70BA.description: Apply academic and career – related content knowledge and skills (foundation, pathway, cross cluster) through technology, research, problem-solving, work- based learning, and project-based learning.

8BD3FB77B0E24B78B8C77EF75E7191AD.description: Apply academic content standards of the Maryland State Curriculum.

0A3FE20CFCC649069AE36177D043E25F.description: Indicator A. Acquire cluster and academic content knowledge and skills to succeed in high school and beyond.

1725AECEDE8044D4A32B6E899BC49B03.description: Career Preparation: Students shall prepare for postsecondary and career success through a sequenced academic and technical program of study and related workplace experiences.

13043871364D4FA7B854E023CF6B88DB.description: Describe the impact of one’s culture, beliefs, and attitudes on one’s career decisions.

392DF852F56A450D86955E69737D2088.description: Demonstrate the use of a decision-making model to inform academic and career planning on an ongoing basis.

60D204AC16704DAB8C87CE4A76CE9068.description: Indicator B. Use a process/model for knowing and thinking about how one makes decisions.

A456FBDCE189476481354F17028687C2.description: Select options for further education and/or training (i.e. dual enrollment, articulated credit, advanced placement, certification, two-year colleges, our-year colleges, apprenticeships, and technical schools.)

CA4D6985FC294DF58A78B890CC052D32.description: Apply academic/career-related content standards including CTE programs of study, if applicable, to work-based learning experiences and one’s program sequence (high school plan).

F4F674B0D66642F488360CF4D2A97A6C.description: Design a program sequence for selected academic/career options including, if applicable, CTE programs of study, postsecondary education and/or training opportunities.

A11FF64EDABD4907A6E74EE0C32B2311.description: Demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to transfer effectively from one learning level to the next.

4A050122B3754E66BBC17D4583C92696.description: Review one’s academic and career plan, including postsecondary options and make modifications on an annual basis.

764EB6E66489494A9A8F743922A13C0C.description: Prepare an academic and career plan based on high school graduation requirements, a sequence of Career Technology Education (CTE) program of study courses, related academics and postsecondary options.

5C81AA3465F942A0BCF6F696C717C19A.description: Career Exploration – Students shall assess career cluster choices and related career pathways including Career Technology Education (CTE) programs of study in order to develop an academic and career plan.

00950F78B96C407AB28AF2423191C80F.description: Identify the connections between life roles and lifestyle.

D0EEEDF793474D1EAE893E7BB9693950.description: Examine one’s personal, leisure, community, learner, work roles, and responsibilities and illustrate how they are interconnected.

B3081870B7344E46B53F7D6CA37D2F1E.description: Indicator E. Understand that balancing personal, leisure, community, learner and work roles is an important part of one’s career development.

2CF41D7B1A564DBEABF851FDCD02FC6A.description: Explain how decision-making may involve compromise and cite examples.

D893634290624F998A1C5557696429E0.description: Examine the implications of decisions, consider new alternatives, and analyze the need to compromise and its effect on one’s decisions.

CDB20F8198B54E4EA5BD55BA542B3420.description: Explain how one’s career decision-making reflects personal priorities (e.g. financial, educational, leisure).

022A073CD0E74757AF5B18DF751FBCF1.description: Evaluate the relationships among education, skills, career choices, economic conditions and income.

23616FE2D37943BA951029DE4F52A736.description: Explore and evaluate career information relevant to making a decision.

BB9445A90DFC4E05860E36AB8314A6E8.description: Indicator D. Recognize that decision-making is an important part of an individual’s career development.

9DD73491D46746BDAC73A9CA0B5BDF8B.description: Evaluate career assessment results to identify a career cluster related academic courses and program of study to inform academic and career planning.

40148918E36A47BA8A26EBEB5D9F7E78.description: Demonstrate openness to and consider career cluster and options that one might view as nontraditional (i.e. relative to one’s gender, race, culture, or ability.)

639A8BF17FFD47728F30E911C8BC47CB.description: Compare and contrast earning power with levels of education and training of careers within clusters of interest.

7FDAA1FF42A749EFBD7E0BC74B430067.description: Compare occupations and careers within a career cluster using labor market information to determine post secondary education opportunities including two-year and four-year college programs, certificate programs, apprenticeship, and trade school options.

139FC39B50D5499FAA593AB4E885022C.description: Evaluate and identify relevant career information resources to use in selecting and planning for a career cluster and career pathway. (i.e., economic, labor market, and employer-specific).

BF9F0107F3674448816CBD457E016909.description: Indicator C. Understand how accurate, current and unbiased career information is necessary for successful career planning and management using career clusters.

A032CD44444F45F385E181E144304ACA.description: Use technology to access, store, manage, analyze and communicate information to enhance and improve achievement.

98AE8E736D674D3A8068D0D58AFB95E7.description: Use study skills, strategies and learning habits to improve achievement.

542ACDD2E23C4040A039ADEE2A3B08A0.description: Analyze the connections between one’s educational achievement and personal and career goals and adjust behavior in a way that integrates the strong connections.

3E319421CD4442BCA66DC8C36F81DC6B.description: Analyze the connections between one’s educational achievement and personal and career goals and adjust behavior in a way that integrates the strong connections.

20489BA27274488CB92B7CF8832706D0.description: Assess past, present, and future informal and formal learning experiences that connect to one’s life goals.

C9D7678D1CEA419A8A772FDCB762A55F.description: Indicator B. Understand the connections among educational achievement, lifelong learning and the career options across career pathways.

4EB624E6112245FF8E41F7A7681B5479.description: Compare/contrast the shift in the work organization of the 21st century versus the past.

66271D89A78F44079E35F2904CE6E91E.description: Identify and research career clusters and CTE programs of interest.

73EA4557A20745339111B6889B96FD48.description: Indicator A. Analyze/compare the industries represented in Maryland’s 10 Career Clusters and how they relate to the needs and functions of the economy and society.

1D4C549B961A4C92B623AE6233DB2B70.description: Career Awareness – Students shall use the Maryland Career Clusters and career pathways including Career and Technology Education (CTE) programs of study in order to understand their relationship to educational achievement and life-long learning.

5A53E8DC687248A1BFA48E352EEAD3D5.description: Evaluate financial choices based on available resources, needs, and wants for goods and services

E52C147F6535475989831F065017364E.description: Revise academic and career plan to reflect growth and development.

0137D7A2878445C996FF58796832E3D3.description: Plan and follow steps to make effective decisions and achieve goals for learning and performance.

3F27B1C7AF7E4F71881114782B05396C.description: Indicator D. Apply self-knowledge to decision-making and goal-setting.

254C77FF06C24507AFF15221EAF1CF17.description: Explain how motivations and aspirations changed with time and circumstance.

1F5178CFF805483AABB1DD8DA09DBEBA.description: Demonstrate and analyze how effectively one responds to change and/or initiates change.

C582D3F52AE9477FB841EDA85101AA6F.description: Identify situations (e.g. applying to college, seeking employment, experiencing problems in school, encountering financial instability, developing a disability, and design strategies to access resources, including other people, to seek assistance when needed.

14DC9C61864C4F8381ABF88C3C854D32.description: Analyze the results of personal growth and change throughout life to determine future growth opportunities.

56C5F517CA1D4F409D74F4031750C7C4.description: Indicator C. Recognize that growth and change are integral parts of the career development process.

E4F4965EB7E84B878159525BD00B8694.description: Demonstrate, problem-solve, and evaluate communication experiences and use of effective strategies such as paraphrasing, reflections, active listening, and assertive communication.

95ECC8375BDB4FA29D6E29DE3A72FD29.description: Demonstrate the ability to support group decisions, respect dissenting positions, and/or use consensus.

605898A764FD48CBA55C202B7BA35DAF.description: Evaluate individual and group performance and plan improvements using explicit criteria.

20978844450F4118A1CA57E98F20248C.description: Demonstrate and assess the degree to which one accepts responsibility for personal actions including dealing with outside pressures and contributing to group activities.

ACDCA0311A2049F4A97081E4BE25BAFF.description: Assess the degree to which one interacts and uses feedback to adjust behavior in group activities in a way that is honest, fair, helpful, and respectful.

93ECDF414A82468FB2C6D60B0EF49127.description: Indicator B. Demonstrate positive interpersonal skills and respect for diversity to facilitate one’s career development.

3227FC9C6A9D44B786B4B567ABB5FA8C.description: Evaluate how the impact of situations, attitudes, and the behaviors of others affect one’s self concept and how one’s behaviors and attitudes affect the self-concept of others.

8F5F5A872F6E40379C5E8506C4A8963F.description: 2. Explain and assess how one’s self-concept affects and promotes both educational achievement and success at work.

266D619A80F543EB8E3579086B10BEB3.description: 1b. Evaluate how positive personal characteristics affect one’s career development.

2D5A682BB14A4196AADEA1D9E60FCE85.description: Integrate a broad range of interests into one’s personal learning and career goals, and assess the impact of abilities, strengths, skills, and talents on one’s career development.

DC3DBBF787514D1F8DF7E1DB2C5CED51.description: Indicator A. Acquire and apply self-knowledge to understand one’s abilities, strengths, interests, skills, and talents as seen by self and others.

F7859563187B43DBB08D2E861F1ACF3E.description: Self-Awareness – Students shall acquire and apply self-knowledge in order to develop personal, learning and career goals.
